title: Integrated Program for Problem-Solving and Linguistic Instructional Explanation to Improve Javelin Throwing Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Possesses intermediate-level specialized knowledge and problem-solving skills, basic language communication abilities (reading, writing, listening, speaking), and grammatical comprehension
context.additional_context: Professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields participate in a motor skill learning program utilizing linguistic communication skills (text analysis, writing, expression). Emphasizes self-directed learning and collaborative activities (discussions, feedback) using personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Learners identify technical elements of the javelin-throwing motion at 80%+ accuracy per phase and explain them using linguistic expressions (vocabulary, grammar).

Learners correct errors occurring during javelin-throwing performance three consecutive times through problem-solving practice and provide clear linguistic feedback (pronunciation, expression) to peers.

Learners apply biomechanical principles to improve motion efficiency by 15% during javelin-throwing based on instructor explanations and organize findings into structured text (written work, reports).

Learners receive feedback from three or more peers via PBL (Problem-Based Learning), establish improvement plans in two of three language skills (pronunciation, vocabulary, grammar), submit weekly implementation reports (reading comprehension, expression) over eight weeks, and achieve â‰¥70% goal attainment.

resources: Javelin Training Equipment (Practice Javelins, Safety Mats)
Digital Collaboration Tools for PBL Activities

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
